# transform

**Instance Property**

The transform applied to the node relative to its parent. Animatable.

## Declaration

```swift
var transform: SCNMatrix4 { get set }
```

```swift
var transform: SCNMatrix4 { get set }
```

## Discussion

The transformation is the combination of the node’s [doc://com.apple.scenekit/documentation/SceneKit/SCNNode/rotation], [doc://com.apple.scenekit/documentation/SceneKit/SCNNode/position], and [doc://com.apple.scenekit/documentation/SceneKit/SCNNode/scale] properties. The default transformation is [doc://com.apple.scenekit/documentation/SceneKit/SCNMatrix4Identity].

When you set the value of this property, the node’s [doc://com.apple.scenekit/documentation/SceneKit/SCNNode/rotation], [doc://com.apple.scenekit/documentation/SceneKit/SCNNode/orientation], [doc://com.apple.scenekit/documentation/SceneKit/SCNNode/eulerAngles], [doc://com.apple.scenekit/documentation/SceneKit/SCNNode/position], and [doc://com.apple.scenekit/documentation/SceneKit/SCNNode/scale] properties automatically change to match the new transform, and vice versa. SceneKit can perform this conversion only if the transform you provide is a combination of rotation, translation, and scale operations. If you set the value of this property to a skew transformation or to a nonaffine transformation, the values of these properties become undefined. Setting a new value for any of these properties causes SceneKit to compute a new transformation, discarding any skew or nonaffine operations in the original transformation.

You can animate changes to this property’s value. See [doc://com.apple.scenekit/documentation/SceneKit/animating-scenekit-content].

## Managing the Node’s Transform (SceneKit Types)

- **position**: The translation applied to the node. Animatable.
- **rotation**: The node’s orientation, expressed as a rotation angle about an axis. Animatable.
- **eulerAngles**: The node’s orientation, expressed as pitch, yaw, and roll angles in radians. Animatable.
- **orientation**: The node’s orientation, expressed as a quaternion. Animatable.
- **scale**: The scale factor applied to the node. Animatable.
- **pivot**: The pivot point for the node’s position, rotation, and scale. Animatable.
